instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power
threads.message: Have this board, appears  have gotten slight liquid spill on J4402 and around  the components close to it, as far as <DIODE>D3370</DIODE>. I'm not reading any shorts on any of those components. I do get a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_PMICLDO</SIGNAL>, about 9ohms. <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is clearly blown with a hole on the top of the chip. My question is, can i replace this with one i purchase online or do i have to pull it from a donor board due to board specific restriction?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No power
threads.message: One removed from 2016/17 board models should work.
